title: Price Elasticity and Quantity Demanded of Shoes

content.question: The demand curve for shoes is downward sloping, and the absolute value of the price elasticity of demand is <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. If the price of shoes increases by <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent, what will happen to the quantity of shoes demanded?

choices.label: It will decrease by <math alttext="6%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.
It will decrease by <math alttext="3%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.
It will decrease by <math alttext="2%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.
It will increase by <math alttext="6%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.
It will increase by <math alttext="3%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: It will decrease by <math alttext="6%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Determine the effect(s) of a change in an economic situation using quantitative data or calculations.
